result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody M Roberts was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Cody M Roberts is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Cody M Roberts was found guilty of Intimidate Victim/Use or Attempt Force [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution to be taken from Prison Wages to the extent allowed

Plus Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect the debt.  You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

Defendant Cody M Roberts in court with attorney Erika Caroline Bahnson.  Defendant Cody M Roberts in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 14TR194.  State will stand mute for sentencing.  Restitution is requested by the State in the amount of $40,000.00, and would request this be taken from prison funds to the extent allowed.  Friends and family  of DE make statements of support to the court.  DE makes statement to the court.  Court will impose 8 years, four years in/four years out,  consecutive to sentence currently serving.  No contact with victim Charles Ramsey, CC, DNA sample, surcharge waived.
Alternative Pre sentence Investigation filed by Atty Bahnson
